intro: Euphrasia alpina var. vidalii, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering stems are often branched. This variety is known for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
